snippet: Laws passed by the City Council have sought to restrict prisoner transfer agreements with federal authorities, prompting guarded celebration among immigrants’ advocates.
lead_paragraph: Laws passed by the City Council have sought to restrict prisoner transfer agreements with federal authorities, prompting guarded celebration among immigrants’ advocates.
abstract: Laws passed by the New York City Council over past two years have sought to restrict prisoner transfer agreements with federal authorities; city, in response to federal requests, has long transferred foreign-born detainees into federal custody, often leading to their deportation; restrictions on this cooperative agreement from City Council appear to be achieving their goal, prompting guarded celebration among immigrants' advocates.

headline.main: New York City Increases Its Resistance to Federal Entreaties on Foreign-Born Detainees
headline.print_headline: City Increases Its Resistance to Federal Entreaties on Foreign-Born Detainees
